required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Single and Double Operator Techniques in Ultrasound-guided Peripheral Nerve Block Learning Curve
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Single and Double Operator Techniques in Ultrasound-guided Peripheral Nerve Block Learning Curve for Anesthesia Residency Training on a Gelatin-based Phantom Model: a Prospective Randomized Controlled Study

brief_summary.textblock: Aim of this study is to compare learning curves of single(1- Jedi grip: Pappin and Christie/ 2- Bedforth/ 3- on lock: Gupta and Berrill) and double operator ultrasound-guided peripheric nerve block techniques on a home-made gelatin-based phantom model.

detailed_description.textblock:
Ultrasound-guided peripheral blocks are conventionaly performed by double operators. One operator controls both the ultrasound probe and peripheric block needle. Another assistant operator aspirate or injects local anesthetic. In this technique operator do not sense resistance in the syringe. Also this technique requires a well-done communication and coordination between operators.
In order to eliminate disadvantages of this technique several single-operator grip techniques of the needle and syringe have been described(1- Jedi grip: Pappin and Christie/ 2- Bedforth/ 3- on lock: Gupta and Berrill). Single operator techniques allow the provider to perform independently.
Aim of this study is to compare learning curves of single and double operator ultrasound-guided peripheric nerve block techniques on a home-made gelatin-based phantom model.

primary_outcome.time_frame: during implementation of procedure on phantom model(first session)
primary_outcome.description: Time(sec) from start command to correct grip of the probe, needle and syringe for each technique

primary_outcome.time_frame: during implementation of procedure on phantom model(first session)
primary_outcome.description: provided image quality by resident for each technique which is assessed by investigator by four point Liker Scale( 1- much worse 2- worse 3- better 4- much better)

primary_outcome.time_frame: during implementation of procedure on phantom model(first session)
primary_outcome.description: number of attempts until correct needling to target area

primary_outcome.time_frame: during implementation of procedure on phantom model(first session)
primary_outcome.description: time to reach target area with block needle

primary_outcome.time_frame: during implementation of procedure on phantom model(first session)
primary_outcome.description: successful if injected water flows from hose of model/ unsuccessful if solution do not flow

primary_outcome.description: Time(sec) from start command to correct grip of the probe, needle and syringe for each technique

primary_outcome.description: Time(sec) from start command to correct grip of the probe, needle and syringe for each technique

primary_outcome.description: provided image quality by resident for each technique which is assessed by investigator by four point Liker Scale( 1- much worse 2- worse 3- better 4- much better)

primary_outcome.description: provided image quality by resident for each technique which is assessed by investigator by four point Liker Scale( 1- much worse 2- worse 3- better 4- much better)

primary_outcome.description: number of attempts until correct needling to target area

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during implementation of procedure on phantom model(third session)
secondary_outcome.description: Resident assessment of each techniques for Mental Demand ,Physical Demand, Temporal Demand, Performance, Effort and Frustration

Residents assesment of pre-procedural education with a questtionarie. "Education was sufficient enough to safely perform peripheral block": I absolutely agree I approve I am indecisive I do not approve Absolutely Disagree

arm_group.description: resident control block needle and ultrasound probe and asistant operator inject the solution. resident reach the target area created in the phantom model using a block needle with ultrasound guidance

resident control block needle, ultrasound probe and syringe independently with jedi grip; reach the target area created in the phantom model using a block needle with ultrasound guidance; inject and aspirate the solution.

resident control block needle, ultrasound probe and syringe independently with on-lock grip; reach the target area created in the phantom model using a block needle with ultrasound guidance; inject the solution.

resident control block needle, ultrasound probe and syringe independently with bedforth's alternative grip; reach the target area created in the phantom model using a block needle with ultrasound guidance; inject the solution.

intervention.intervention_name: reaching targeted area on the phantom model
intervention.description: resident reach the targeted area on the phantom model using ultrasoun guidance and independently or with asistance inject the solution

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- To be a junior resident of anesthesiology(< 2 years )
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refusal of resident

reference.citation: Pappin D, Christie I. The Jedi Grip: a novel technique for administering local anaesthetic in ultrasound-guided regional anaesthesia. Anaesthesia. 2011 Sep;66(9):845. doi: 10.1111/j.1365-2044.2011.06845.x.
Gupta P, Berrill A. 'On lock' - a further single-operator ultrasound-guided regional anaesthesia grip. Anaesthesia. 2017 Oct;72(10):1289. doi: 10.1111/anae.14050.
Bedforth N, Townsley P, Maybin J, Eisenberg E. Single-handed ultrasound-guided regional anaesthesia. Anaesthesia. 2011 Sep;66(9):846. doi: 10.1111/j.1365-2044.2011.06864.x.
Miyake S. Factors influencing mental workload indexes. J UOEH. 1997 Dec 1;19(4):313-25. Review.
